oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of a mixture of biotite- and apatite-rich rock powder in a soil with inherent low soil fertility
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bleken, Ass. prof Marina Azzaroli
Krogstad, Prof. Tore
Speetjens, Koen
Heim, Ass. pref. Michael
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nutrient turnover
Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Long-term fertility of organically managed soils is challenged by repeated removal of plant nutrients through cash crops. The use of selected rock powders may contribute to maintain soil fertility. A pot trial with Italian ryegrass and white clover was used in order to study the potential of a biotite-rich and of an apatite-rich rock powder to maintain and improve the nutrient supply of organically managed soils.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Bleken, Ass. prof Marina Azzaroli; Krogstad, Prof. Tore; Speetjens, Koen and Heim, Ass. pref. Michael (2008) Use of a mixture of biotite- and apatite-rich rock powder in a soil with inherent low soil fertility. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
